intro: Bartsia australis, commonly known as the Australian bartsia, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and heathlands. Its small, clustered flowers are usually pink or red, and it produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Bartsia australis is characterized by its lack of true leaves, with photosynthesis occurring through its stems and flowers.
